intro: Corydalis remota f. rotundiloba, commonly known as the broad-leaf Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southwestern China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spurred flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant features basal leaves that are broad and rounded, giving it its specific epithet "rotundiloba." It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories or rocky habitats. The flowers bloom in early spring, adding a delicate touch of color to its natural setting.
